required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Psychometric Measurement Properties of the Michigan Hand Questionnaire in Patients After Flexor Tendon Repair
clinical_study.official_title: Psychometric Measurement Properties of the German Version of the Michigan Hand Questionnaire in Patients After Flexor Tendon Repair

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to investigate the psychometric properties of the German Version of the Michigan Hand Questionnaire in patients with flexor tendon injuries, including reliability, validity and interpretability.

primary_outcome.description: The MHQ is a hand specific questionnaire used to measure the ability in daily function. The total score ranges from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better performance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Disabilities of Shoulder, Arm and Hand Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: The DASH questionnaire is a region-specific outcome instrument. The patient will rate 30-items about disability or symptoms by rating the degree of difficulty in doing various activities. The scores of all items are used to calculate a score ranging from 0 (no disability) to 100 (most severe disability). The DASH is a region-specific outcome instrument. The patient will rate 30-items about disability or symptoms by rating the degree of difficulty in doing various activities. The scores of all items are used to calculate a score ranging from 0 (no disability) to 100 (most severe disability).

study_pop.textblock: Patients with flexor tendon injuries in Zone I-V for in the fingers and/or thumb.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent as documented by signature
- â‰¥ 18 years old
- Understanding of the German language (written and oral)
- Single and multiple finger injuries
- Primary flexor tendon injuries in Zone I-V for the fingers and/ or thumb
- Treated by the hand surgery department at the Inselspital Bern
- Treated with at least a 4-strand core suture
Exclusion Criteria:
- < 18 years old
- Inability to follow the procedures of the study, e.g. due to language problems, diagnosed psychological disorders or dementia of the patients
- Replantation of the injured finger
- Fracture of the injured finger
- Primary tendon reconstructions
